Title: Become a Donor Today, Help Others While Making Extra Cash
Attributes:
compensation: Up to $1,000 per month

employment type: part-time
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The GoodNature™ Program is offering an amazing opportunity for healthy people who want to potentially make a difference in the lives of patients with serious diseases! This unique program is striving to do medical good – and can put some extra spending money in your pocket. If you are a healthy adult 18 to 50 years old, you may be eligible to earn up to $1,000 a month in compensation. Not only that, but your participation could also help lead to future developments in medicine and directly serve a patient population in need.

The GoodNature™ Program is recruiting healthy individuals who are of a normal weight, don’t smoke, and have no history of gastrointestinal disease or alcohol or drug abuse. You must be available to travel to our collection site in Cambridge to donate your poop three to seven times a week. People cannot participate while they’re pregnant, though we encourage them to keep us in mind for the future.

Title: Do you experience extreme sleepiness while working early morning shift
Attributes:
compensation: up to $4750

employment type: full-time

non-profit organization
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The Division of Sleep Medicine at Brigham & Women’s Hospital is seeking individuals who:
• are 18 to 64 years old
• start work between 3AM-6AM at least 3 days per week
• are very sleepy during the daytime
Individuals who meet these criteria may be eligible for a sleep research study. The purpose of this study is to see if a medication can help with excessive daytime sleepiness in early morning shift workers. This study will ask participants to make 6 study visits over the course of 6 weeks.

Receive up to $4750

For more information, call 617-525-8657 or email EDSresearchstudy@partners.org

Or fill out the following survey https://redcap.link/DAWNstudy

Title: Come Sleep With Us! Sleep Study at BWH Needs Volunteers
Attributes:
compensation: Receive up to $6,250

employment type: part-time
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The Division of Sleep and Circadian Disorders at Brigham & Women’s Hospital is seeking healthy volunteers ages 20-40 to participate in a research study. You must be a non-smoker and not on any medications (other than birth control). You will complete 1 in-person and 3 remote screening visits and must keep a regular sleep schedule for 2 weeks. If eligible, you will live 33 consecutive days and nights in a private room in our clinical research center. 

We want to learn more about how insufficient sleep night after night impacts metabolism, and how exposure to artificial light at night plays a role. 

If you would like to be screened for participation, please follow the link below and fill out our pre-screening survey: 
https://redcap.partners.org/redcap/surveys/?s=ECM4EEDWLT

Receive up to $6,250. 

For more information, call 617-525-8838, e-mail us or visit https://rally.partners.org/study/alan.

Attributes:
compensation: Receive up to $1,800

employment type: part-time

internship

non-profit organization
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The Division of Sleep Medicine at Brigham & Women’s Hospital is seeking healthy volunteers ages 21-35 to participate in a sleep research study. You must be a non-smoker and not on any medications.

You will complete 4 screening visits and must keep a regular sleep schedule for 2 to 4 weeks. If eligible, you will live 5 consecutive days and nights at the sleep research laboratory within the hospital.

The purpose of this study is to see if the body’s internal ‘clock’ time can be estimated from a single blood sample.

Receive up to $1,800.

Title: Earn Up to $1,500 by Becoming a Sperm Donor!
Attributes:
compensation: Earn up to $1,500 per month

employment type: part-time
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post



California Cryobank is looking for sperm donors of all ethnicities in Cambridge.  


Why should you consider  applying? Earn up to $1,500 per month while helping others around the world start their family. Plus, these extra perks: 

- Appointments on your schedule 
- Get paid every two weeks 
- Less than 5 hours per month required! 
- Free ancestry report and genetic testing 

We are taking all necessary precautions in safeguarding against COVID-19, including the testing of donors and employees. 

 Basic Requirements for California Cryobank Sperm Donors:  

- Between 19 and 38 years old  
- Now attending or have graduated from college 
- Professional experience considered in lieu of college education 
- Legally allowed to work in the US 

  APPLY NOW! Remember, qualified donors will earn $1,500 per month for their time. 

See what former sperm donors say about their experience  here.

Learn more at:  spermbank.com 

 
Founded in 1977, California Cryobank is a full-service sperm bank providing a comprehensive resource for frozen donor sperm, private semen cryopreservation, and specialized reproductive services (including egg and embryo storage). We are extremely proud of our 40+ years of reproductive success and have distinguished ourselves as a leader in the industry and #1 physician recommended sperm bank in the world.

Anton’s Cleaners is currently seeking an experienced presser to work in busy processing plant. Previous dry cleaning or pressing experience is preferred.

Title: New Year, New Job! Starting $17/Hr., PT Flexible; No Experience
Attributes:
compensation: $17 per hour to start

employment type: part-time
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


APPLY NOW here: https://careers.hireology.com/seniorshelpingseniorsgreaterboston/683148/description?ref=Craigslist

Come work for the best in 2022! For the 4th year running, Seniors Helping Seniors of Greater Boston and Metrowest has been named a top workplace with the happiest employees in Massachusetts (#3 Medium Company) in The Boston Globe's Top Places to Work Survey*, and we're looking for exceptional people to join our team of personal helpers/companions! (*The Boston Globe, December 5, 2021)

NO EXPERIENCE REQUIRED...WE TRAIN!

Under our unique model of peers-helping-peers, we hire older adults to work one-on-one with elderly clients in the community, providing non-medical services that may include:
*Companionship
*Shopping/errands
*Light housekeeping
*Transportation
*Activities
*Meal prep
*and more!

We offer:
*Above-average starting wage of $17 per hour
*Paid training for newly hired employees
*Employee referral bonuses
*Flexible schedules from 12 hours up to 30+ hours per week
*Earned sick time
*Continuing education opportunities and fun networking/social events
*An interesting and diverse client base
*A friendly group of peers to work with

This opportunity is for you if you are:
*An older adult who is retired/semi-retired or laid off
*An older adult who needs part-time flexible work to supplement your income
*An older adult who enjoys engaging with people and being helpful to others
*An older adult who would like to use your skills in a different line of work
*An older adult who would like to do rewarding work with a purpose
*An older adult who is available 12-15 hours per week (or more!)

We're actively hiring older adults who are compassionate, reliable, and flexible.
Minimum requirements:
*Older adult with 45+ years of life experience
*Availability of at least 12 - 15 hours per week
*Covid-19 vaccinated
*Driver's license and insured auto (our clients are not accessible by public transportation)
*Cell phone
*Personal email account and ability to send/receive emails
*Conversational English fluency
*Weekend availability a plus (in addition to weekdays)
*Live centrally in our Metrowest service area with accessibility to multiple client locations including: Acton, Ashland, Framingham, Holliston, Hopkinton, Hudson, Lincoln, Marlborough, Maynard, Southborough, Sudbury, Wayland, Weston

Hear it straight from our employees: https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=2928045503990460

We look forward to hearing from you!

About Us:
Seniors Helping Seniors of Greater Boston & Metrowest is a unique home care agency that provides personalized care for seniors by seniors. Focusing specifically on the importance of social-emotional care and companionship, our agency carefully matches personal helpers/companions with clients in the community to help maximize social engagement, assisting with everything from light housework and shopping to daily companionship. Today, Seniors Helping Seniors of Greater Boston and Metrowest is the leading provider of peer-to-peer companion care in Massachusetts, serving over 30 towns throughout the Greater Boston and Metrowest regions.

¡Bienvenido!

Contact Design (dba SurveyFeeds) es una organización de investigación global que conecta a los participantes cualificados con empresas de tecnología para ayudar a mejorar la usabilidad y el diseño de sus productos.

Title: Women with Jewish Lineage-Earn $10,000 with the Gift Of Egg Donation
Attributes:
compensation: Starts at $10,000 +all expenses paid

employment type: employee's choice
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post



A Jewish Blessing, LLC* was founded as a compassionate response to infertile Jewish families worldwide who desperately need help finding qualified and extraordinary young Jewish women who have a generous spirit and the desire to give them the gift of life through Egg Donation.

Participation as an egg donor involves:
· Time
· Reliability
· Honesty
· Dedication

Benefits of Participating as an Egg Donor Include:
· First Time Donors Earn $10,000/Repeat & Proven Successful Donors Can Earn $11,000+ per donation
· Travel Opportunities or Stay Local- All Expenses Paid
· Genetic Carrier Screening Testing Results
· Flexibility to Continue Working or Attending School While Helping a Family in Need
· Receive Valuable Information About Your Own Fertility
Most Importantly, the deep satisfaction and joy experienced by knowing that you have altered the lives of others in such a meaningful way.

Initial Egg Donor Qualifications are:
· Be a female between the age of 20 and 32
· Have Jewish ethnic heritage on Mother’s and/or Father’s side of their family
· Body Mass Index (BMI) must be less than 30
· Be in good health and follow a healthy lifestyle
· Be a non-smoker


TO START THE PRE-QUALIFYING APPLICATION, GO TO: https://intakeq.com/new/pfCiNu/9BKKa8
or contact Sivonne, our Donor Intake Coordinator, at eggdonor@ajewishblessing.com


* A Jewish Blessing, LLC (AJB) is a nurse-run organization and is a member of SART/ASRM (Society for Assisted Reproductive Technology/American Society for Reproductive Medicine), following their ethical guidelines for egg donation. To learn more about AJB, please visit our website at: http://www.ajewishblessing.com/donors.html

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for passing the word forward to friends and family who may have a desire to help. Wishing you and your loved ones a very happy and meaningful 2022!!

keywords: egg donor, egg donation, donor, IVF, fertility, infertility, third party reproduction, flexible

Title: Surrogate Mother Needed! Help a Family Grow and Earn up to $57,000!
Attributes:
compensation: Between $52,000 and $57,000 Base Fee plus all expenses paid and additional paid allowances

employment type: contract
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post






"Click Here to Learn More"




Why Become a Surrogate with The Center For Surrogacy and Egg Donation?

Have the chance to give the most precious of gifts to a loving couple in need: the gift of life.
Earn a Base Fee of $52,000 for a first time surrogacy and $57,000 for experienced surrogates, plus all expenses paid.
In addition to your Base Fee and Expenses being paid, you will also earn $3,300 in totally monthly allowances to use as you see fit and $500 to put towards maternity clothing
Enjoy the financial freedom of being able to pay off student loans, make a down payment on a home, or create a college fund for your own children.
Experience the CSED difference by working with a passionate and dedicated staff, who will guide you every step of the way, allowing surrogacy to fit into the busiest of schedules.
Retain 100% of your fee, as all expenses will be paid through our agency.



About The Center For Surrogacy and Egg Donation, Inc.

CSEDInc is one of the country's oldest and most well-respected Egg Donation and Surrogacy agencies. We offer a superior level of care and attention to our intended parents and Surrogate Mothers (Gestational Carriers). For more detailed information on our gestational carrier program, please visit our website by clicking  "Click Here to Learn More", or feel free to call us at (508) 460-0400. 




Requirements for Potential Surrogates:

Female
Between the ages of 21 and 40 
In Good Physical Health, Who Has Delivered,  With a good Pregnancy Health History.
Be Reliable and Committed to the Surrogacy Process
Non-Smoker
Have Strong Support From Friends and Family



"Click Here to Learn More"



The Center For Surrogacy and Egg Donation was founded by a previous intended parent, whose family needed the assistance of a surrogate mother like you to make the dream of having a child come true. Robert Nichols, the President of CSED, has had the good fortune of being able to have three children though the kindness and compassion a Surrogate Mother. This experience prompted Robert to start an agency that would always put the interests of the Surrogates and Parents above all else. Our commitment to this ideal is apparent at every step of this process. If you are interested in becoming a Surrogate Mother, please research as much as you can, contact fertility clinics in the area, and ask them to recommend the best agency in New England; we are confident that agency will be us.


            

Testimonials
            
          

"This was such a wonderful experience. I would love to do it again. I wanted to thank
            you for everything." 
- Gestational Carrier J.C. 

"They really are the best and I'm soooo glad I did this, it has been a journey that I couldn't and wouldn't take back for anything!"
- Gestational Carrier T.G.

Title: Summer 2022 Intern
Attributes:
compensation: DOE

employment type: full-time

internship
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


As part of firm-wide efforts to increase the diversity of economic and environmental consultants, IEc is excited to offer two paid summer Intern positions in 2022. Applicants should be entering their junior or senior undergraduate year and self-identify as members of a group historically underrepresented in the environmental and economic professions, including, but not limited to Black, African American, Hispanic, Latinx, Asian American, Pacific Islander, and North American Indigenous groups. 

Our summer Interns will have the opportunity to apply their academic skills to current, real-world IEc projects through a comprehensive, hands-on learning experience. Working with other IEc staff, summer Interns will assist with data compilation and evaluation, perform quantitative analyses, and communicate results through written products and oral presentations. Required skills include paying attention to detail, asking questions, identifying potential solutions when challenges arise, and recommending next steps to move a project forward. 
Summer Interns must demonstrate academic experience in at least one of a wide range of disciplines relevant to our work including but not limited to economics, applied mathematics, public policy, engineering, finance, chemistry, biology, ecology, and other environmental sciences.

Position Type: Full Time, Temporary
Position Start Date: Summer 2022
Position Location: Cambridge, MA – relocation assistance available
Required Qualifications: Coursework towards a bachelor’s or equivalent international degree in a relevant field (see above). 

To apply, visit https://www.indecon.com/open-positions

When applying, you must upload the following documents:
-Cover Letter
-Resume
-Undergraduate Transcript
-Writing Sample – this should be authored solely by you, be no more than 5 pages in length (can be an excerpt from a longer paper) and focus on technical information/analysis.

If the recruiting committee is interested in pursuing your application, we will contact you directly after January 17 to set up a screening interview.   

EOE AA M/F/Veterans/Disability

Title: Research Analyst
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


IEc is seeking individuals with a bachelor’s degree (or international equivalent) to join our firm as Research Analysts (RAs). Working with other IEc staff, RAs gather and evaluate data; perform quantitative analyses using a variety of economic, financial, or scientific methods; and communicate results in both written and oral form. Consulting work at IEc requires skills including paying close attention to detail, asking questions, identifying potential solutions when challenges arise, and recommending next steps to move a project forward. RAs must independently manage their time to meet deadlines and contribute to a project team. 	

Research Analysts must demonstrate academic experience in at least one of a wide range of disciplines relevant to IEc’s work including but not limited to economics, applied mathematics, public policy, engineering, finance, chemistry, biology, ecology, and other environmental sciences.

Research Analysts are eligible for promotion to Senior Research Analyst. Because most advanced positions at IEc require a graduate degree, RAs and Senior RAs often depart for graduate school or other career opportunities after working at IEc for approximately two to four years.  

Position Type: Full Time  
Position Start Date: Immediate and Spring hires 

Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s or equivalent international degree in a relevant field (see above). If you have a graduate degree, please apply for the Associate position and not the RA position.  

To apply, visit https://www.indecon.com/open-positions

When applying, you must upload the following documents:
-Cover Letter
-Resume
-Undergraduate Transcript
-Writing Sample – this should be authored solely by you, be no more than 5 pages in length (can be an excerpt from a longer paper) and focus on technical information/analysis.

If the recruiting committee is interested in pursuing your application, we will contact you directly after January 17 to set up a screening interview.   

EOE AA M/F/Veterans/Disability

employment type: part-time
Description:

California Cryobank is looking for sperm donors of all ethnicities in Cambridge.  


Why should you consider  applying? Earn up to $1,500 per month while helping others around the world start their family. Plus, these extra perks: 

- Appointments on your schedule 
- Get paid every two weeks 
- Less than 5 hours per month required!

We are taking all necessary precautions in safeguarding against COVID-19, including the testing of donors and employees.

  APPLY NOW! Remember, qualified donors will earn $1,500 per month for their time.

Founded in 1977, California Cryobank is a full-service sperm bank providing a comprehensive resource for frozen donor sperm, private semen cryopreservation, and specialized reproductive services (including egg and embryo storage). Title: Admissions Counselor
Attributes:
compensation: $40,000/yr

employment type: full-time

non-profit organization
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Status: Full-time, Exempt

Summary Statement: The Admissions Counselor is responsible for a wide range of activities related to recruitment and enrollment of new undergraduate and pre-college program students. This position serves as a first point of contact for prospective students and their families, providing information and advisement on the admissions process, financial aid, academic program and curriculum, student services programs, and the general educational, residential and extra-curricular environment at the college. The Admissions Counselor travels extensively in the Fall; conducts presentations, reviews portfolios, provides data entry, tracks, completes, and reviews applications in support of the enrollment goals of the College. This position works collaboratively with the entire admissions staff to provide strategic and operational direction around territory and inquiry management and to meet and exceed the College's enrollment goals. This position will also act as a mentor to enrolled international students to ensure their success in the academic and social environments. The Admissions Counselor reports to the Director of Admissions.

Major Functional Areas and Description of Duties:
•	Serves as a primary contact for high school art teachers, guidance counselors, prospective students and their families relative to their interest in the College
•	Represent the College at a variety of on-and off-campus events as well as virtual events including college fairs, portfolio days, school visits and on-campus admission events
•	Prepares and presents digital slideshow lectures to high school and community college art departments to introduce the College to prospective students and further strengthen art educator relationships
•	Extensive local, regional, national and potential international travel (surface and air) is required including weekends and evenings, particularly during the fall recruiting season. Due to COVID travel restrictions, much of this work has been conducted virtually
•	Develops and maintains assigned recruitment territories and itineraries
•	Maintains communication of travel schedule with admissions office
•	Maintains thorough record keeping and reporting of activities and expenses relating to the recruitment
•	Counsels prospective students and their families and evaluates application materials, including the portfolio of visual art and academic credentials for the purpose of admission to the College
•	Runs and utilizes basic database reports for management of recruitment pool
•	Participates and assists in the development and execution of admissions programs and events; including the pre-college summer program, the art educator institute summer program and on-campus open events
•	Assists in the processing of applications and conduct campus tours
•	Assists the Director of Admissions with other projects as needed

Qualifications: (Experience, Skills & Abilities)

Education
•	Bachelor’s degree is required. Bachelor of Fine Arts degree is preferred, especially one from a regionally accredited, independent college of art

Experience
•	Prior admissions or art instruction experience considered a plus

Travel
•	Ability to do extensive regional, national and international travel is necessary to promote the College, especially during the months of September through December

Communication/Professionalism:
•	Excellent verbal and written skills are essential in this highly visible position 
•	Strong public speaking skills
•	Commitment to enrolling and retaining a diverse student body
•	Strong interpersonal skills, a commitment to quality teamwork
•	Skilled at building rapport and maintaining strong relationships with key stakeholders
•	Self-motivated, works well on both group and individual projects
•	Good sense of humor

Office and Administrative Skills:
•	Must have practical knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel, and basic computer literacy
•	Social media experience
•	Database management and experience considered a plus  

Complexity and Organization:
•	Excellent organizational skills and ability to accomplish multiple tasks, work under pressure and meet deadlines
•	Ability to problem-solve and work effectively without direct supervision
•	Ability to work in an independent and proactive manner to meet goals and expectations

Working Conditions/Physical Demands:
•	Ability to lift heavy materials (50lb boxes)
•	Ability to travel for extensive periods of time

Special Notations or Conditions of Employment:
•	Must possess a valid driver’s license and clean driving record 
•	Must be able to work additional hours including weekends and evenings 

To Apply:
Please submit a letter of interest and current resume to Human Resources at Montserrat College of Art, jobs@montserrat.edu, with the subject line “Admissions Counselor”. Resumes must be received by Friday, January 7, 2022. 

All members of the community are expected to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have an approved exemption in place for medical or religious reasons. For more information regarding the College’s vaccine requirements please refer to our webpage https://www.montserrat.edu/covid-19-vaccine-policy.

Montserrat College of Art does not offer visa sponsorship.

Montserrat College of Art is committed to creating an environment of talented and diverse faculty and staff members. Montserrat is an equal opportunity employer and seeks to diversify its workforce as a key initiative in our strategic plan. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Title: Surrogate Mother Needed! Help a Family Grow and Earn up to $57,000!
Attributes:
compensation: Between $52,000 and $57,000 Base Fee plus all expenses paid and additional paid allowances

employment type: contract
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post






"Click Here to Learn More"




Why Become a Surrogate with The Center For Surrogacy and Egg Donation?

Have the chance to give the most precious of gifts to a loving couple in need: the gift of life.
Earn a Base Fee of $52,000 for a first time surrogacy and $57,000 for experienced surrogates, plus all expenses paid.
In addition to your Base Fee and Expenses being paid, you will also earn $3,300 in totally monthly allowances to use as you see fit and $500 to put towards maternity clothing
Enjoy the financial freedom of being able to pay off student loans, make a down payment on a home, or create a college fund for your own children.
Experience the CSED difference by working with a passionate and dedicated staff, who will guide you every step of the way, allowing surrogacy to fit into the busiest of schedules.
Retain 100% of your fee, as all expenses will be paid through our agency.



About The Center For Surrogacy and Egg Donation, Inc.

CSEDInc is one of the country's oldest and most well-respected Egg Donation and Surrogacy agencies. We offer a superior level of care and attention to our intended parents and Surrogate Mothers (Gestational Carriers). For more detailed information on our gestational carrier program, please visit our website by clicking  "Click Here to Learn More", or feel free to call us at (508) 460-0400. 




Requirements for Potential Surrogates:

Female
Between the ages of 21 and 40 
In Good Physical Health, Who Has Delivered,  With a good Pregnancy Health History.
Be Reliable and Committed to the Surrogacy Process
Non-Smoker
Have Strong Support From Friends and Family



"Click Here to Learn More"



The Center For Surrogacy and Egg Donation was founded by a previous intended parent, whose family needed the assistance of a surrogate mother like you to make the dream of having a child come true. Robert Nichols, the President of CSED, has had the good fortune of being able to have three children though the kindness and compassion a Surrogate Mother. This experience prompted Robert to start an agency that would always put the interests of the Surrogates and Parents above all else. Our commitment to this ideal is apparent at every step of this process. If you are interested in becoming a Surrogate Mother, please research as much as you can, contact fertility clinics in the area, and ask them to recommend the best agency in New England; we are confident that agency will be us.


            

Testimonials

            you for everything." 
- Gestational Carrier J.C. 

"They really are the best and I'm soooo glad I did this, it has been a journey that I couldn't and wouldn't take back for anything!"

compensation: $21-27/hr. We offer overtime pay, paid training, regular raises, sick pay, healthcare for full-time staff and bonuses for friend referrals.

employment type: employee's choice

Canvass on Behalf of Greenpeace
Hiring Immediately -  $21-27/hr, Full-time & Part-time

Help Up Build Support for the Nation’s Leading Environmental Group! 
Greenpeace is bringing people together to protect the environment. If you want to combat the climate crisis, protect forests, expand renewable energy, or promote environmental justice, join us!  We are building support and fundraising on behalf of Greenpeace to ensure they have the resources to save our planet for future generations.  Our top campaign right now is building support to pass the Climate Bill through Congress.  We have seen the wildfires and storms and other devastating effects

Get paid well! Staff should expect to earn $21-27/hour.  We offer overtime pay, paid training, regular raises, sick pay, healthcare for full-time staff and bonuses for friend referrals.

Stay Safe!  We have strict health and safety protocols that include a contactless approach to campaign work. We provide all of the training and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) you will need. 

Apply here: https://www.wave-fundraising.com/apply-now/?SC=CraigslistF2F

Location: Boston, MA

We are hiring immediately, all positions are year-round with possibilities for advancement. Shifts run from 2:30pm - 10:00pm Monday-Friday with the possibility to work part-time or full-time.

Canvasser Responsibilities:
- Engage with the public in a friendly and professional manner
- Deliver a compelling campaign story, sign up members and generate donations for Greenpeace
- Participate in staff trainings to improve your outreach skills
- Strictly follow our health and safety protocols

The ideal candidate:
-Passionate about environmental issues and combating the climate crisis
-Strong communication skills; you should enjoy working with other people and be willing and excited to speak with everyone
-Hard worker who will stay motivated to engage as many people as possible
-Open to new challenges and are interested in building their campaign skills
-Culturally competent and able to respectfully engage with teammates and the community

Prior canvassing experience is a plus but not required.
Pay: Expect hourly rate - $17-$25. We offer overtime pay, paid training, regular raises, sick pay, healthcare for full-time staff and bonuses for friend referrals.

Apply here: https://www.wave-fundraising.com/apply-now/?SC=CraigslistF2F

We are committed to equity, inclusion, and anti-racism. Title: Come Sleep With Us! Sleep Study at BWH Needs Volunteers
Attributes:
compensation: Receive up to $6,250

employment type: part-time
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The Division of Sleep and Circadian Disorders at Brigham & Women’s Hospital is seeking healthy volunteers ages 20-40 to participate in a research study. You must be a non-smoker and not on any medications (other than birth control). You will complete 1 in-person and 3 remote screening visits and must keep a regular sleep schedule for 2 weeks. If eligible, you will live 33 consecutive days and nights in a private room in our clinical research center. 

We want to learn more about how insufficient sleep night after night impacts metabolism, and how exposure to artificial light at night plays a role.

https://redcap.partners.org/redcap/surveys/?s=ECM4EEDWLT

You have your own BR and bath, rent free is part of the compensation.  If this sounds like it could be you, please contact us for further information.  It's a great job for the right person who has some flexibility, a good sense of humor, and wants to make a real difference in someone's life.

Attributes:
compensation: Pay is per walk. Walkers will earn an average of $16-$22 per hour.

employment type: employee's choice
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Join our growing team at Uncle Phil’s Pet Care! A local neighborhood pet services company offering dog walking and pet sitting since 2014. 

We are seeking dog walkers for part-time, full-time, or weekend hours in the Roslindale/West Roxbury/Jamaica Plain area. 

Do you?

-love animals and want to earn extra money while giving them the best possible care?
-have the ability to be outdoors and walk in all kinds of weather?
-have reliable transportation, preferably your own car?
-have a Smartphone with texting capabilities to use our online scheduling program?
-have the ability to commit to a schedule once you’ve accepted an assignment? 
-have the ability to pass a background check? 

This is a 1099 independent contractor position that pays per walk with the opportunity to earn an average of $16-20 per hour. Pet sitting assignment rates vary. 

Experience is preferred but we could be willing to train the right person!

Please respond with a resume letting us know if you’re interesting in dog walking or pet sitting opportunities, full or part-time hours, and what experience you’ve had working with or caring for animals. 

We look forward to hearing from you!

Work when you want, wherever you want.Earn 100% of your tips.Qualify for Fast Pay and get paid daily.Be a part of an exciting and rapidly growing community across over 1,000 cities in the U.S.REQUIREMENTS:✓ Any Car, Bicycle, or Scooter✓ iPhone or Android smartphone✓ Valid Driver's License and insurance (only applicable to cars)✓ 18+ years of ageABOUT US:DoorDash is a technology company that connects customers with local businesses. Customers order meals and other items from their favorite local merchants and Dashers deliver it directly to their doors. Dashers are third party contractors who deliver for merchants to customers. Dashing is designed to be extremely flexible. Deliver part-time or full-time -- it's up to you! You get to set your own schedule and deliver wherever you want.  *Dashers are paid per delivery. Earnings vary based on pay per delivery and number of deliveries completed per hour.Driving with DoorDash is perfect for a those looking for seasonal work, temporary work, part time work, part-time work, or for those looking for a flexible full time opportunity. Hours are completely flexible. You can create your own schedule. No previous experience as a transportation driver, truck driver, taxi driver, courier driver or delivery driver is necessary. We welcome those who have driven with other gig economy platforms such as Seamless, Grubhub, Eat24, Munchery, Saucey, Drizly, Google Express, AmazonFresh, Lyft, Favor, Caviar, Uber, UberX, Side car, Sprig, Instacart, Rinse, Shyp, Washio, Luxe, Zirx, Post mates, Farm Hill, Rinse, Deliv, Amazon Prime, and Ease. Our driving partners come from all backgrounds and industries ranging from traditional driving and transportation industries to more customer service and creative industries. Title: Surrogate Mother Needed! Help a Family Grow and Earn up to $57,000!
Attributes:
compensation: Between $52,000 and $57,000 Base Fee plus all expenses paid and additional paid allowances

employment type: contract
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post






"Click Here to Learn More"




Why Become a Surrogate with The Center For Surrogacy and Egg Donation?

Have the chance to give the most precious of gifts to a loving couple in need: the gift of life.
Earn a Base Fee of $52,000 for a first time surrogacy and $57,000 for experienced surrogates, plus all expenses paid.
In addition to your Base Fee and Expenses being paid, you will also earn $3,300 in totally monthly allowances to use as you see fit and $500 to put towards maternity clothing
Enjoy the financial freedom of being able to pay off student loans, make a down payment on a home, or create a college fund for your own children.
Experience the CSED difference by working with a passionate and dedicated staff, who will guide you every step of the way, allowing surrogacy to fit into the busiest of schedules.
Retain 100% of your fee, as all expenses will be paid through our agency.



About The Center For Surrogacy and Egg Donation, Inc.

CSEDInc is one of the country's oldest and most well-respected Egg Donation and Surrogacy agencies. We offer a superior level of care and attention to our intended parents and Surrogate Mothers (Gestational Carriers). For more detailed information on our gestational carrier program, please visit our website by clicking  "Click Here to Learn More", or feel free to call us at (508) 460-0400. 




Requirements for Potential Surrogates:

Female
Between the ages of 21 and 40 
In Good Physical Health, Who Has Delivered,  With a good Pregnancy Health History.
Be Reliable and Committed to the Surrogacy Process
Non-Smoker
Have Strong Support From Friends and Family



"Click Here to Learn More"



The Center For Surrogacy and Egg Donation was founded by a previous intended parent, whose family needed the assistance of a surrogate mother like you to make the dream of having a child come true. Robert Nichols, the President of CSED, has had the good fortune of being able to have three children though the kindness and compassion a Surrogate Mother. This experience prompted Robert to start an agency that would always put the interests of the Surrogates and Parents above all else. Our commitment to this ideal is apparent at every step of this process. If you are interested in becoming a Surrogate Mother, please research as much as you can, contact fertility clinics in the area, and ask them to recommend the best agency in New England; we are confident that agency will be us.


            

Testimonials
            
          

"This was such a wonderful experience. I would love to do it again. I wanted to thank
            you for everything." 
- Gestational Carrier J.C. 

"They really are the best and I'm soooo glad I did this, it has been a journey that I couldn't and wouldn't take back for anything!"
- Gestational Carrier T.G.

Title: Advances in Fibromyalgia research could start with you.
Attributes:
compensation: Up to $350

employment type: part-time
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Fibromyalgia medications not relieving your pain? You may qualify for clinical trials that are testing study medications not available through your regular doctor. 

Research studies are an important part of developing potential future treatment options. Without them, progress in medicine would not be possible. Right now, doctors are looking for people with Fibromyalgia to volunteer for local research studies.

Get Started Now
SEE IF YOU QUALIFY 
OR CALL
1-833-304-8807


For more information, visit www.Studiesforfibro.com 


Those who qualify may receive*: 
•	Payment that varies by study up to $350
•	No-cost study-related care from local doctors
•	No-cost study medication 

Plus, no health insurance is needed!


About Acurian: 

Acurian is a company that recruits people for clinical research studies. We are currently working with pharmaceutical companies to find individuals who are willing to participate in clinical research studies in your area. 

* In a research study, the participants may receive investigational study product or may receive an inactive substance, or placebo, depending on the study design. Participants receive study-related care from a doctor/research team for the duration of the study. For studies that offer compensation, reasonable payments will be made for participation. The length of the study may vary.

Title: Fight the Climate Crisis! Campaign Staff Needed! -  $21-$27/hr
Attributes:
compensation: $21-27/hr. We offer overtime pay, paid training, regular raises, sick pay, healthcare for full-time staff and bonuses for friend referrals.

employment type: employee's choice
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Canvass on Behalf of Greenpeace
Hiring Immediately -  $21-27/hr, Full-time & Part-time

Help Up Build Support for the Nation’s Leading Environmental Group! 
Greenpeace is bringing people together to protect the environment. If you want to combat the climate crisis, protect forests, expand renewable energy, or promote environmental justice, join us!  We are building support and fundraising on behalf of Greenpeace to ensure they have the resources to save our planet for future generations.  Our top campaign right now is building support to pass the Climate Bill through Congress.  We have seen the wildfires and storms and other devastating effects

Get paid well! Staff should expect to earn $21-27/hour.  We offer overtime pay, paid training, regular raises, sick pay, healthcare for full-time staff and bonuses for friend referrals.

Stay Safe!  We have strict health and safety protocols that include a contactless approach to campaign work. We provide all of the training and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) you will need. 

Apply here: https://www.wave-fundraising.com/apply-now/?SC=CraigslistF2F

Location: Boston, MA

We are hiring immediately, all positions are year-round with possibilities for advancement. Shifts run from 2:30pm - 10:00pm Monday-Friday with the possibility to work part-time or full-time.

Canvasser Responsibilities:
- Engage with the public in a friendly and professional manner
- Deliver a compelling campaign story, sign up members and generate donations for Greenpeace
- Participate in staff trainings to improve your outreach skills
- Strictly follow our health and safety protocols

The ideal candidate:
-Passionate about environmental issues and combating the climate crisis
-Strong communication skills; you should enjoy working with other people and be willing and excited to speak with everyone
-Hard worker who will stay motivated to engage as many people as possible
-Open to new challenges and are interested in building their campaign skills
-Culturally competent and able to respectfully engage with teammates and the community

Prior canvassing experience is a plus but not required.
Pay: Expect hourly rate - $17-$25. We offer overtime pay, paid training, regular raises, sick pay, healthcare for full-time staff and bonuses for friend referrals.

Apply here: https://www.wave-fundraising.com/apply-now/?SC=CraigslistF2F

We are committed to equity, inclusion, and anti-racism. We are an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage Black, indigenous, people of color, women, people with previous felony convictions, members of the LGBTQIA+ community, and others who identify with underrepresented groups to apply.

Title: Do you experience extreme sleepiness while working early morning shift
Attributes:
compensation: up to $4750

employment type: full-time

non-profit organization
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The Division of Sleep Medicine at Brigham & Women’s Hospital is seeking individuals who:
• are 18 to 64 years old
• start work between 3AM-6AM at least 3 days per week
• are very sleepy during the daytime
Individuals who meet these criteria may be eligible for a sleep research study. The purpose of this study is to see if a medication can help with excessive daytime sleepiness in early morning shift workers. This study will ask participants to make 6 study visits over the course of 6 weeks.

Receive up to $4750

For more information, call 617-525-8657 or email EDSresearchstudy@partners.org 

Or fill out the following survey https://redcap.link/DAWNstudy

Title: Seeking a Highly Intelligent Egg Donor! Compensation up to $40K 🥚💜
Attributes:
compensation: Compensation up to $40K for the right candidate.

employment type: employee's choice

telecommuting ok
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


We are a well-respected egg donation and surrogacy agency in Southern California. We currently have 5 high-profile Intended Parents actively searching for a highly intelligent and well-educated donors. We are looking for someone who has attended or is currently attending an Ivy League or equivalent Top Tier school for an Undergraduate Degree, Graduate or Master's Degree or a Doctorate Program. We are also looking for donors with high standardized test scores and high intelligence. 

The compensation for this cycle will range from $25,000 to $40,000 for the candidate that is chosen. 

Please press reply at the top of the page to contact me if you believe you fit the criteria or would like more information. We can also put you in touch with previous donors to get a better understanding of the experience. Or, if you would like to sign up directly, please go to our website:  https://www.genesissurrogacy.com/egg-donor-application. 

Benefits:
*Generous compensation for your time and effort
*Thousands of dollars worth of genetic testing results for your own records
*Learn more about your own fertility and valuable information for your future family planning
*Change someone’s life in a way that is truly the world’s greatest gift! Intended Parents are typically couples who have been through many years of struggles just hoping to be parents, cancer survivors, women who learned early on that they would never be able to have children from their own eggs, or same sex couples.
*Work with one of the top agencies in the country so that you can make sure you are taken care of throughout the process

Minimum Egg Donor Requirements:
- Must have a desire to help people and must be mature/responsible
- Between the ages of 18-29
- You CANNOT be a smoker or have ANY drug use within the last 3 months
- You must have regular periods (If you have an IUD, it needs to be non-hormonal)
- You CANNOT have a family history of clinical depression or mental illness
- You must have at least 1 semester of college/trade school or be pursuing a successful modeling/acting/musical/art career
- You must be height/weight proportionate (BMI must be less than 27)

I am also searching for a few other potential candidates for clients who don't have as many requests so if you think you would be a good fit for egg donation, I would love to hear from you.

"*Please note that these are very special cases and not the "norm" in terms of egg donation cycles. We would love for you to apply to our regular program with regular compensation amounts if you do not meet ALL of the requirements this client has. The typical compensation for a first time donor is between $6,000 - $10,000. This is also dependent on verifiable personal and educational achievements and your compensation may be raised after each subsequent cycle."

Things You Should Know:
*Being a donor does NOT cause infertility
*You will need to go to about 6-8 doctor's appointments in a 2-month time frame (paid for by the client)
*The process should not be painful and you should be able to go back to work/school the day after your retrieval
*You can live anywhere in the United States and be a donor
*Being a donor will not cost you anything out of pocket

Title: 💕Egg Donors in Demand!! Earn up to $10K and give the gift of life💕
Attributes:
compensation: up to $10,000

employment type: contract
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post



  


Experience the Deepest Kind of Gratitude... and EARN UP TO $10,0000!



  Do you qualify? YES, if:



  You are a female between the ages of 18-29.

  You lead a healthy lifestyle.

  You do not have a history of genetic diseases.

  You are a non-smoker.


  You are a non-drug user.

  You have a Body Mass Index (BMI) of 29 or less.

  You love giving back to others.

"I was so happy to hear my recipient couple was pregnant. It made me feel like I was able to make a difference in someone's life, and that meant the world to me. This is why I wanted to donate, and the pregnancy news made my day! " 
~ Donor H. 

Many couples and individuals are looking for their Donor.YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE!




  BENEFITS INCLUDE:

  

 Generous compensation for your time and efforts.
  Full support from a case manger once your match is confirmed.
  Continue your education or work while you donate.
  No cost incurred by you during the process.
  Fulfill some of your dreams while helping someone else as well.







 





Once you fill out the application form, one of our coordinators will be in touch with more details.  

 Any inquiries and questions are welcome at info@laeggdonors.com or Toll Free 1-888-261-4574.

 


 







Fertility Clinic, Egg Donation, Egg Donor, IVF, IUI, In Vitro Fertilization, Los Angeles, High Compensation, Become a Donor, Donor Program

Title: Advances in Fibromyalgia research could start with you.
Attributes:
compensation: Up to $350

employment type: part-time
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Fibromyalgia medications not relieving your pain? You may qualify for clinical trials that are testing study medications not available through your regular doctor. 

Research studies are an important part of developing potential future treatment options. Without them, progress in medicine would not be possible. Right now, doctors are looking for people with Fibromyalgia to volunteer for local research studies.

Get Started Now
SEE IF YOU QUALIFY 
OR CALL
1-833-304-8807


For more information, visit www.Studiesforfibro.com 


Those who qualify may receive*: 
•	Payment that varies by study up to $350
•	No-cost study-related care from local doctors
•	No-cost study medication 

Plus, no health insurance is needed!


About Acurian: 

Acurian is a company that recruits people for clinical research studies. We are currently working with pharmaceutical companies to find individuals who are willing to participate in clinical research studies in your area. 

* In a research study, the participants may receive investigational study product or may receive an inactive substance, or placebo, depending on the study design. Participants receive study-related care from a doctor/research team for the duration of the study. For studies that offer compensation, reasonable payments will be made for participation. The length of the study may vary.

Title: Come Sleep With Us! Sleep Study at BWH Needs Volunteers
Attributes:
compensation: Receive up to $6,250

employment type: part-time
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The Division of Sleep and Circadian Disorders at Brigham & Women’s Hospital is seeking healthy volunteers ages 20-40 to participate in a research study. You must be a non-smoker and not on any medications (other than birth control). You will complete 1 in-person and 3 remote screening visits and must keep a regular sleep schedule for 2 weeks. If eligible, you will live 33 consecutive days and nights in a private room in our clinical research center. 

We want to learn more about how insufficient sleep night after night impacts metabolism, and how exposure to artificial light at night plays a role. 

Receive up to $6,250. 

For more information, call 617-525-8838, e-mail us or visit https://rally.partners.org/study/alan.

Title: Help Us Learn More About Circadian Rhythms! 5-day Research Study
Attributes:
compensation: Receive up to $1,800

employment type: part-time

internship

non-profit organization
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The Division of Sleep Medicine at Brigham & Women’s Hospital is seeking healthy volunteers ages 21-35 to participate in a sleep research study. You must be a non-smoker and not on any medications.

You will complete 4 screening visits and must keep a regular sleep schedule for 2 to 4 weeks. If eligible, you will live 5 consecutive days and nights at the sleep research laboratory within the hospital.

The purpose of this study is to see if the body’s internal ‘clock’ time can be estimated from a single blood sample.

Receive up to $1,800. 

For more information, call 617-525-8813,  or visit https://rally.partners.org/study/bodyclockstudy

Title: Full Time Hospital Greeter
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Job Summary

The Hospital Lobby Greeter is responsible for creating a warm and welcoming experience for each patient and visitor. They are a true customer service professional who inherently loves to help others and is happy to eliminate any anxiety that can come with a hospital visit. From welcoming patients and visitors to answering questions and assisting with wayfinding, this critical role sets the tone for the rest of the individual’s visit.

Open shifts: 

M- F  9:00am - 5:00pm
M- F  10:00am - 6:00pm
M- F  12:00pm - 8:00pm
M- F  2:30pm - 10:30pm
M- F  3:00pm - 8:00pm 
Sa - Su 7:00am - 3:00pm
Sa - Su 3:00pm - 8:00pm 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities (including but not limited to): 

Provides a warm welcome to all entering the facility, offering to provide assistance where needed
Ensure that patients and visitors are aware of and adhering to hospital entrance policies such as universal masking and visitor restrictions
Guide patients, visitors and employees to the mask station and be sure they put on the MGH issued mask and sanitize their hands
Goes above and beyond by anticipating patient and visitor’s needs, such as:
Holding doors or offering wheelchair assistance
Assisting with wayfinding
Ensures hospital lobbies and public areas are clean, safe, and uncluttered in accordance with all infection control standards
Monitors hallways, elevators, stairwells and congregating areas to ensure that individuals are maintaining a safe 6 ft. distance from one another
Support to security as an additional vigilant set of eyes and ears at the hospital entrance
Performs other related duties as assigned
Required Skills/Abilities (including but not limited to): 

Possesses exceptional customer service skills
Maintains a warm, friendly and professional demeanor when working with other employees, patients and visitors
Ability to read, understand, and communicate effectively both verbally and on paper
Ability to proactively solve problems, but also knows when to ask for help
Education and Experience

High School degree or equivalent
At least one year related experience strongly preferred
Physical Demands and Working Environment (including, but not limited to): 

The physical demands of this position and the work environment characteristics described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential job functions.

Physical Demands

The Lobby Greeter will be required to stand for most of their shift, walk, sit, reach with hands or arms, talk and hear. Lobby Greeter must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 20lbs and be able to wear PPE (personal protective equipment) for the duration of their shift.

Work Environment

The employee may be subjected to weather conditions prevalent at the time. The noise level in this work environment can range from minimal to moderate.

Beacon Hill Hospitality is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).

Disclaimer

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and complexity of the work being performed by personnel assigned to this classification, and do not represent an exhaustive list of all tasks, duties, and responsibilities required of personnel assigned to this position.

Title: Do you experience extreme sleepiness while working early morning shift
Attributes:
compensation: up to $4750

employment type: full-time

non-profit organization

telecommuting ok
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The Division of Sleep Medicine at Brigham & Women’s Hospital is seeking individuals who:
• are 18 to 64 years old
• start work between 3AM-6AM at least 3 days per week
• are very sleepy during the daytime
Individuals who meet these criteria may be eligible for a sleep research study. The purpose of this study is to see if a medication can help with excessive daytime sleepiness in early morning shift workers. This study will ask participants to make 6 study visits over the course of 6 weeks.

Receive up to $4750

For more information, call 617-525-8657 or email EDSresearchstudy@partners.org

Or fill out the following survey https://redcap.link/DAWNstudy

Title: Earn $50-70k+ as a Surrogate✨ Great 2nd Job
Attributes:
compensation: 1st time Surrogate compensation starts at $50,000 + $1k screening bonus!  Experienced surrogates earn more!

employment type: contract
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post



Calling all mothers out there! What if you could help give the most beautiful gift in the world to another family while financially helping your own?



Surrogacy is a rewarding experience for everyone involved. You don’t have to choose between surrogacy or a job. You can do surrogacy as a stay-at-home mom or as a second job, all while getting compensated for it. We admire your desire to give the most beautiful gift in the world to a family, while financially helping your own.






"In my quest to fulfill my dream of helping a family through surrogacy I researched several agencies in the California area. I found so many great reviews on Physician's Surrogacy. I called and the staff was quick to answer all my questions. They certainly helped put my mind at ease and was the first agency (I called several) tat I spoke with where I finally sensed "this is where I belong."


Your safety and happiness are our primary concern. A surrogacy journey is an emotional and complex medical process that can change lives and bring joy to all involved. Our team of physicians work diligently to ensure a safe and smooth journey. Take the first step by completing your application today to find out if you're eligible. Did you know you can earn up to $11,000 before you are even pregnant? 











Physician's Surrogacy is the leading surrogacy agency in San Diego, with the largest program in North America, providing comprehensive agency services for more than 20 years.
Our in-house physicians and caring surrogacy coordinators will be happy to guide you through our surrogacy process. Also, our in-house OB liaison can answer any medical questions you may have. Together, we have over 150+ combined years of clinical and professional experience.



Basic Criteria:


Ages 20-37 years old
Have had at least one child of your own
No major complications during pregnancy and/or delivery
Live a healthy lifestyle (no drugs, smoking and healthy body weight)
Arizona, California, Colorado, DC, Delaware, Florida, Illinois, Maine, Maryland, New Hampshire, New Jersey, Nevada, Oregon, Texas, Rhode Island, South Carolina, Utah, Vermont,  or Washington Resident















Our compensation package is hard to beat, but if you find a higher package, we will happily match it.
Second or third time surrogates will qualify for higher compensation. 
		As with most agencies, compensation is commensurate with experience, and experienced 
		surrogates will qualify for higher compensation. At Physician's Surrogacy, we believe 
		surrogates should be compensated for the time, commitment, and physical sacrifices 
		made during their journey.








The Ultimate Surrogacy Experience:


 With our monthly support groups, dedicated support teams, and lifetime opportunity, we provide a convenient, caring, and experienced environment for this beautiful journey. One of our experienced Surrogate Coordinators would love to speak with you and answer any questions you may have.











Have Questions Before You Apply? 


We offer informal information calls to make sure that surrogacy is right for you and your family. To further enhance your decision-making process, you can also call or text to set an appointment to visit our facility.  Feel free to 
chat with us on our website if you have any further questions.







Follow Us

Individuals who meet these criteria may be eligible for a sleep research study. The purpose of this study is to see if a medication can help with excessive daytime sleepiness in early morning shift workers. This study will ask participants to make 6 study visits over the course of 6 weeks.

Receive up to $4750

For more information, call 617-525-8657 or email EDSresearchstudy@partners.org

Or fill out the following survey https://redcap.link/DAWNstudy

Title: Come Sleep With Us! Sleep Study at BWH Needs Volunteers
Attributes:
compensation: Receive up to $6,250

employment type: part-time
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The Division of Sleep and Circadian Disorders at Brigham & Women’s Hospital is seeking healthy volunteers ages 20-40 to participate in a research study. You must be a non-smoker and not on any medications (other than birth control). You will complete 1 in-person and 3 remote screening visits and must keep a regular sleep schedule for 2 weeks. If eligible, you will live 33 consecutive days and nights in a private room in our clinical research center. 

We want to learn more about how insufficient sleep night after night impacts metabolism, and how exposure to artificial light at night plays a role. 

Receive up to $6,250. 

For more information, call 617-525-8838, e-mail us or visit https://rally.partners.org/study/alan.

Title: Help Us Learn More About Circadian Rhythms! 5-day Research Study
Attributes:
compensation: Receive up to $1,800

employment type: part-time

internship

non-profit organization
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The Division of Sleep Medicine at Brigham & Women’s Hospital is seeking healthy volunteers ages 21-35 to participate in a sleep research study. You must be a non-smoker and not on any medications.

You will complete 4 screening visits and must keep a regular sleep schedule for 2 to 4 weeks. If eligible, you will live 5 consecutive days and nights at the sleep research laboratory within the hospital.

The purpose of this study is to see if the body’s internal ‘clock’ time can be estimated from a single blood sample.

Receive up to $1,800. 

For more information, call 617-525-8813,  or visit https://rally.partners.org/study/bodyclockstudy

Title: Do you have HYPERTENSION and want to participate in a RESEARCH STUDY?
Attributes:
compensation: up to $1500

employment type: part-time
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


You may be eligible to participate in a blood pressure study that focuses on the effect of the protein STRIATIN on blood pressure. The study is at the forefront of personalized medicine and will help us to determine the most effective treatment option for hypertension based on each individual’s specific genetic profile.

You may qualify for the study if you…
•	Are above the age of 18
•	Have hypertension
•	Do not have any other serious medical conditions

The study involves eating a low salt diet, taking an FDA-approved study medication for
four months and participating in outpatient visits at the CCI at Brigham and Women’s Hospital.

Initial participation in this study consists of a medical history and physical exam, including a blood draw and urine collection for routine analysis. This research study will last approximately 4 months. Your participation in this study is entirely voluntary.

Receive up to $1500 upon completion of the study.

For more information, please complete the following screening survey at https://redcap.partners.org/redcap/surveys/?s=7K3YRAH78Y

All information will be kept strictly confidential to our research study staff and information
obtained in this survey will be used for research recruitment purposes only. If you are a
good match for the study based on this survey, a research coordinator from our group
will contact you.

Title: Healthy Volunteers Needed for At-Home Research Study ($50)
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


At Sanguine, we are accelerating medicine with the help of volunteers like you. You can help advance research with a 15-minute blood donation.

Donating is easy, fast, and you will receive $50 for your time without leaving home.

You may qualify to participate if you:
• Live in Massachusetts
• Are 18 years of age or over
• Are in general good health

To sign up, visit here or call (855) 836-4759 to speak with a research coordinator and see if you qualify.

About Sanguine
Sanguine is a leading provider of at-home clinical research services empowering patients to participate in research studies from the comfort of their homes using smart technology and a mobile health staff. For more information, visit sanguinebio.com.

Title: Online Apparel Seller Needs Data Entry Work-from-Home Support
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Phoenix Trading Company is an online seller of women's apparel and home goods. The company's offices and warehouse are located in Framingham.

Job Summary:
This is a work-from-home position.  You will need to allot 20 hrs per week minimum to this job.  The job requires 3 hours of online training which we will provide.  The job also REQUIRES a basic knowledge of MS Excel.  

The position entails coming to our warehouse, at least once per week (M-F), to pick up boxes of women's apparel, take them home and enter the attributes (size, condition, style, etc) of the items into a spreadsheet, then returning the boxes to the warehouse.  Compensation is $1/item.   Typical rates for experienced employees is 15-22 items per hour.

If interested, please send a resume, or a description of any relevant qualifications.

Thanks!

Title: Surrogate Mother Needed! Help a Family Grow and Earn up to $57,000!
Attributes:
compensation: Between $52,000 and $57,000 Base Fee plus all expenses paid and additional paid allowances

employment type: contract
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post






"Click Here to Learn More"




Why Become a Surrogate with The Center For Surrogacy and Egg Donation?

Have the chance to give the most precious of gifts to a loving couple in need: the gift of life.
Earn a Base Fee of $52,000 for a first time surrogacy and $57,000 for experienced surrogates, plus all expenses paid.
In addition to your Base Fee and Expenses being paid, you will also earn $3,300 in totally monthly allowances to use as you see fit and $500 to put towards maternity clothing
Enjoy the financial freedom of being able to pay off student loans, make a down payment on a home, or create a college fund for your own children.
Experience the CSED difference by working with a passionate and dedicated staff, who will guide you every step of the way, allowing surrogacy to fit into the busiest of schedules.
Retain 100% of your fee, as all expenses will be paid through our agency.



About The Center For Surrogacy and Egg Donation, Inc.

CSEDInc is one of the country's oldest and most well-respected Egg Donation and Surrogacy agencies. We offer a superior level of care and attention to our intended parents and Surrogate Mothers (Gestational Carriers). For more detailed information on our gestational carrier program, please visit our website by clicking  "Click Here to Learn More", or feel free to call us at (508) 460-0400. 




Requirements for Potential Surrogates:

Female
Between the ages of 21 and 40 
In Good Physical Health, Who Has Delivered,  With a good Pregnancy Health History.
Be Reliable and Committed to the Surrogacy Process
Non-Smoker
Have Strong Support From Friends and Family



"Click Here to Learn More"



The Center For Surrogacy and Egg Donation was founded by a previous intended parent, whose family needed the assistance of a surrogate mother like you to make the dream of having a child come true. Robert Nichols, the President of CSED, has had the good fortune of being able to have three children though the kindness and compassion a Surrogate Mother. This experience prompted Robert to start an agency that would always put the interests of the Surrogates and Parents above all else. Our commitment to this ideal is apparent at every step of this process. If you are interested in becoming a Surrogate Mother, please research as much as you can, contact fertility clinics in the area, and ask them to recommend the best agency in New England; we are confident that agency will be us.


            

Testimonials
            
          

"This was such a wonderful experience. I would love to do it again. I wanted to thank
            you for everything." 
- Gestational Carrier J.C. 

"They really are the best and I'm soooo glad I did this, it has been a journey that I couldn't and wouldn't take back for anything!"
- Gestational Carrier T.G.

Title: Women with Jewish Lineage-Earn $10,000 with the Gift Of Egg Donation
Attributes:
compensation: Starts at $10,000 +all expenses paid

employment type: employee's choice
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


A Jewish Blessing, LLC* was founded as a compassionate response to infertile Jewish families worldwide who desperately need help finding qualified and extraordinary young Jewish women who have a generous spirit and the desire to give them the gift of life through Egg Donation.

Participation as an egg donor involves:
· Time
· Reliability
· Honesty
· Dedication

Benefits of Participating as an Egg Donor Include:
· First Time Donors Earn $10,000/Repeat & Proven Successful Donors Can Earn $11,000+ per donation
· Travel Opportunities or Stay Local- All Expenses Paid
· Genetic Carrier Screening Testing Results
· Flexibility to Continue Working or Attending School While Helping a Family in Need
· Receive Valuable Information About Your Own Fertility
Most Importantly, the deep satisfaction and joy experienced by knowing that you have altered the lives of others in such a meaningful way.

Initial Egg Donor Qualifications are:
· Be a female between the age of 20 and 32
· Have Jewish ethnic heritage on Mother’s and/or Father’s side of their family
· Body Mass Index (BMI) must be less than 30
· Be in good health and follow a healthy lifestyle
· Be a non-smoker


TO START THE PRE-QUALIFYING APPLICATION, GO TO: https://intakeq.com/new/pfCiNu/9BKKa8
or contact Sivonne, our Donor Intake Coordinator, at eggdonor@ajewishblessing.com


* A Jewish Blessing, LLC (AJB) is a nurse-run organization and is a member of SART/ASRM (Society for Assisted Reproductive Technology/American Society for Reproductive Medicine), following their ethical guidelines for egg donation. To learn more about AJB, please visit our website at: http://www.ajewishblessing.com/donors.html

To all the extraordinary women who are contemplating the gift of Egg Donation, we celebrate you during this Festival of Lights. Happy Chanukah!!

keywords: egg donor, egg donation, donor, IVF, fertility, infertility, third party reproduction, flexible

Title: Do you experience extreme sleepiness while working early morning shift
Attributes:
compensation: up to $4750

employment type: full-time

non-profit organization
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The Division of Sleep Medicine at Brigham & Women’s Hospital is seeking individuals who:
• are 18 to 64 years old
• start work between 3AM-6AM at least 3 days per week
• are very sleepy during the daytime
Individuals who meet these criteria may be eligible for a sleep research study. The purpose of this study is to see if a medication can help with excessive daytime sleepiness in early morning shift workers. This study will ask participants to make 6 study visits over the course of 6 weeks.

Receive up to $4750

For more information, call 617-525-8657 or email EDSresearchstudy@partners.org 

Or fill out the following survey https://redcap.link/DAWNstudy

Title: Struggle with Fibromyalgia? – Payment up to $350. Varies by study.
Attributes:
compensation: Up to $350

employment type: part-time
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Do you or a loved one suffer from chronic pain caused by Fibromyalgia? If so, you may qualify for local research studies. Right now, area doctors are looking for people who have chronic pain to join clinical trials.

Research studies are an important part of developing potential future treatment options. Without them, progress in medicine would not be possible. Right now, doctors are looking for people with Fibromyalgia to volunteer for local research studies.

Get Started Now
SEE IF YOU QUALIFY 
OR CALL
1-833-304-8807


For more information, visit www.Studiesforfibro.com 


Those who qualify may receive*: 
•	Payment that varies by study up to $350
•	No-cost study-related care from local doctors
•	No-cost study medication 

Plus, no health insurance is needed!


About Acurian: 

Acurian is a company that recruits people for clinical research studies. We are currently working with pharmaceutical companies to find individuals who are willing to participate in clinical research studies in your area. 

* In a research study, the participants may receive investigational study product or may receive an inactive substance, or placebo, depending on the study design. Participants receive study-related care from a doctor/research team for the duration of the study. For studies that offer compensation, reasonable payments will be made for participation. The length of the study may vary.

Title: Become a Sperm Donor! Earn $1,500/mo by Helping to Create Families!
Attributes:
compensation: Earn up to $1,500 per month

employment type: part-time
Description:
QR Code Link to This Post



California Cryobank is looking for sperm donors of all ethnicities in Cambridge.  


Why should you consider  applying? Earn up to $1,500 per month while helping others around the world start their family. Plus, these extra perks: 

- Appointments on your schedule 
- Get paid every two weeks 
- Less than 5 hours per month required! 
- Free ancestry report and genetic testing 

We are taking all necessary precautions in safeguarding against COVID-19, including the testing of donors and employees. 

 Basic Requirements for California Cryobank Sperm Donors:  

- Between 19 and 38 years old  
- Now attending or have graduated from college 
- Professional experience considered in lieu of college education 
- Legally allowed to work in the US 

  APPLY NOW! Remember, qualified donors will earn $1,500 per month for their time. 

See what former sperm donors say about their experience  here.

Learn more at:  spermbank.com 

 
Founded in 1977, California Cryobank is a full-service sperm bank providing a comprehensive resource for frozen donor sperm, private semen cryopreservation, and specialized reproductive services (including egg and embryo storage). We are extremely proud of our 40+ years of reproductive success and have distinguished ourselves as a leader in the industry and #1 physician recommended sperm bank in the world.
